item.title: Notes from "The Crowd: A Study of the Popular Mind"
item.author: guosuiyu@gmail.com (mcsrainbow)
item.description: In a crowd, the individual loses conscious personality and rational judgment, becoming dominated by emotion, suggestion, and the collective unconscious, which leads to impulsive, credulous, and irrational behavior.

item.title: Notes from "Nonviolent Communication: A Language of Life"
item.author: guosuiyu@gmail.com (mcsrainbow)
item.description: Four steps of Nonviolent Communication: observe, identify and state feelings, identify and state needs, and make requests.

item.title: Notes from "Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion"
item.author: guosuiyu@gmail.com (mcsrainbow)
item.description: The 6 principles of persuasion are Reciprocation, Commitment and Consistency, Social Proof, Liking, Authority, Scarcity.

item.title: Notes from "The Willpower Instinct: How Self-Control Works, Why It Matters, and What You Can Do to Get More of It"
item.author: guosuiyu@gmail.com (mcsrainbow)
item.description: The lack of self-control is not only a psychological problem, but also influenced by physiology, psychological traps and various social factors.
